headline: Ham Tetrazzini
description: Stir diced ham into a hearty Cheddar cheese sauce with cooked spaghetti, along with chopped pimento and parsley for color. Dinner's ready in about half an hour!
name: Ham Tetrazzini
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add spaghetti and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain (or use leftover pasta; see Cook's Note).
While pasta is cooking, melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in onion; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
Stir in cream of mushroom soup, 1/2 cup water, and shredded cheese. Heat mixture until cheese melts, stirring often.
Mix in the ham, cooked and drained pasta, chopped pimento, and chopped parsley to saucepan; stir to combine. Cook until mixture is heated through, then serve.

review.reviewBody: I have made this recipe many times. It is quick and easy. I did however make a few changes. One was that I added a small can of mushrooms. The other was instead of 1/2 cup of water I used 3/4 cup of water.
The whole family loved this quick and easy recipe! I added some frozen peas to make it a one dish complete dinner.

We modified this recipe and it was the bomb:
-We used a pint of fresh tuna instead of ham
-added 3 oz of cream cheese
- added 1/4 c of sour cream

Soooo good!!
Made as written, except didn’t have the cream of mushroom on hand, so I used cream of chicken. Turned out delicious, served with some Parmesan cheese on top.

I’m giving this the benefit of the doubt because I like most before me change a lot. I used whole wheat pasta because it’s all I had. My bad. No mushroom soup and I’m allergic to dairy so I sautéed 1.5 c chopped Bella mushrooms with the onion. Added a package of Daiya Alfredo sauce, 1/2 c water and 1/4 c white wine. Used oil preserved dried tomato instead of pimento, and 1/4 broccoli heads chopped as I had no parsley. Topped with a little Parmesan. Other than the WW pasta actually pretty good
We love this recipe! I double it though, skip the peppers and add a little chicken base. It's a hit with the teenagers.

Delicious! I doubled tge recipe. Also made a roux instead of canned cream of mushroom or chicken soup. My roux was started with sautéed mild red peppers and red onions in EVOO. Then flour and broth. Then mild cheddar cheese. Seasoned with garlic and onion powder, s&p, nutmeg, and ginger. Added ham and noodles. Tastes great!

The only substitutions I made was adding a bag of frozen veggies and omitting pimento since I didn't have that. I don't consider adding spices to be a substitution that's pretty normal on any recipe. Got lots of good reviews from all of my kids and even a friend of a kid who was over. Great way to use up left over Christmas ham. Will definitely make again.

Quick casserole. Made mine with leftover ham from Christmas. Used cream of chicken soup and a small can of mushrooms as I had no cream of mushroom soup. I did add a little garlic fir zip. Otherwise, it was as recipe called for and very good.

Nice way to use up Christmas ham leftovers. Came out REALLY thick so I used some of the pasta water and that helped. Also added about 2TBPS of cream just for fun. Wanted to use frozen peas but didn't have any so just sprinkled some canned ones on top just before serving. Husband loves it and I thought it was pretty awesome too!

Next time will try some capers and mushrooms.

This was very tasty! I like one-pot meals, yes even this recipe. I let the pasta cook while I prepped the other ingredients. Then drained the pasta, reserving some pasta water to use with the soup and cheese - thanks to America’s Test Kitchen for that tip. Cooked everything in the pasta pot and then reintroduced the pasta, tossing thoroughly to get every noodle coated in creamy cheesy goodness. Didn’t have pimentos so I omitted that step. For next time I’ll put them on the grocery list. And there WILL be a next time. Hubby and picky daughter both enjoyed it.

I made this tonight for dinner and it was a big hit with the teenagers and husband. I did add two cloves of minced garlic and a few leaves of chopped basil. I think without these it would have been slightly bland.

This recipe is delicious with the changes other readers said...ie. added 2 garlic, more onions, more ham and used chicken broth instead of water. I broiled it until the cheese was brown. Very very good.
Was easy to make at no time at all. My mother and I loved and will most definitely make it again.
As usual it was delicious

This recipe was delicious! Full of flavor. Took me longer than 30 minutes, but it was well worth it. The recipe didn’t call for seasoning, so I added pepper and garlic powder. I also sautéed some celery and mushrooms. This is a definite keeper! Thank you!
Baked it at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Family loved it!

What a delicious recipe! I added a few other ingredients based on my own taste. I added, garlic and mushrooms to the butter and instead of adding water I substituted milk. Based on other comments. When everything was mixed together I added coarse black pepper and a pinch of kosher salt. Delicious dinner and so simple!

This was a wonderful recipe and the only reason it’s not 5 stars is because I made changes based upon our taste and what I had on hand. I used olive oil instead of butter and sautéed 3 chopped garlic cloves with the onion. Based on other reviews I used half low sodium chicken broth and wine for the liquid. Also added a pinch of black pepper and about 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper to the cheese mixture. I didn’t have spaghetti so I used whole wheat rotini for the pasta. Also added minced red pepper and about 1/2 cup frozen peas, mostly for color. Because I had time, I baked this at 350 for about 1/2 hour after topping with mozzarella and additional Parmesan cheese.. This was so yummy and the leftovers tasted even better!

I doubled the recipe. I used 16 oz elbow macaroni. I sauteed onion, green pepper , 1 teaspoon of minced garlic and fresh ground pepper in 1 tbsp of melted butter. I used 1 can of chicken broth instead of water, 2 cans of Healthy Request condensed mushroom soup and 1 cup shredded cheese. Once cheese melted, I mixed that with the drained noodles and 2 cups of leftover Easter ham. Everyone in my family liked it!

It was good but it lacked flavor. I added chicken broth instead of water, 3 garlic cloves, tons of cheese because the mushroom soup takes over the flavor of this dish. I also added broccoli and garlic chile sauce for a little extra spice which made this dish amazing!
Perfect for those hame left overs!

Good and fast. I fiddled with the quantities - using half a small sweet red pepper and about 1/4 a medium onion, and about 200 gm (about 6 2/3 oz) cubed blacj forest ham, instead of the 6 3/4 cups (!) called for the first time I looked at the recipe (obvious typo that disappeared the next time I checked ( technical glitch?). Topped it with ground black pepper and parmesan cheese. YUM!
This was a good meal. Will definitely make it again.
I made it pretty much as the recipe states. My husband and I agree it would be better on ravioli. It’s pretty thick for a spaghetti sauce but it is delicious.
Very good and easy to make. I added more cheese and the mushroom soup have roasted garlic in it.

Turned out pretty good, and used up the leftover ham we were getting tired of eating! Looks like lots of people make changes to this recipe. I did change a couple things as well. I added minced garlic and used roasted red peppers since I had no pimento. Other than that, after cooking on the stovetop, I put it in a pan and added some Parmesan, additional cheese and some fried onions on top and broiled it for a couple minutes. Added a little crunch to the top and made it more casserole-esque. But I think everyone would have liked it either way.
This was very tasty and easy to make. I would make it again. Only change I made is I left out the pimento as some in the family are not a fan of it.

Quick & easy basic recipe
Endless combos possible

I doubled. Used 1 can cr chx and 1 can cr mush soup and 2 c triple cheddar cheese. Instead of water, I used 1/2 c chx broth and 1/2 c milk. I also added some garlic and pepper. I had planned to add peas but forgot. My husband thought it was too creamy. Kids ate it. I thought it was fine for an easy meal, but nothing I will rush to make again.
This is oh so good! I took the main recipe and the from the others.
Family loved it. Thanks for sharing!
Good recipe. I added frozen peas and pimento for more color.
I subbed leftover pork loin roast, cut into small cubes. Terrific!!
Great base recipe. Quick and delicious. I used milk instead of water and added garlic when I was cooking the onions. You could add so many things to change up this meal. I will definitely make again.

Great, easy dish. I used a can of cream of chicken/mushroom soup, added a very few extra veggies that I sauteed with the onion and used half wine, half milk instead of water. We'll have this again and again. Thanks for the recipe!
Substituted milk for water and added a can of mushrooms. After all was combined, placed in casserole dish, topped with freshly grated Parmesan cheese and baked for 20 minutes. Great ham dish.

This was amazing. I used the recipe as a base and added the following: sautéed onions with garlic and mushrooms to add a bit more flavor. I then added about 1/2 cup of cream cheese, substituted chicken broth for water, added about 1/2 cup of shredded Parmesan cheese and increased the amount of cheddar. I then added a bit of fat free half and half. Mixed it all together, put in a casserole dish covered with mozzarella and cooked till top browned.

Great quick, easy recipe that’s very tasty. I will definitely make this again. I had garlic mushroom soup on hand and no pimentos but it was great. My husband liked it too. Next time I’ll try it with the pimentos, they would really add a nice flavor. Thanks for sharing!

Enjoyed making this quick concoction. Added a splash of white wine, plus chicken stock, and peas because we didn't have fresh parsley. Put dried parsley through the mortar and pestle and I think the parsley is a key flavoring to this dish. A dash of seasoning salt finished the dish.
I added mushrooms and carrots and broccoli and peas and water chestnuts. OMGoodness, it was delish. will make this way again.
I made no changes to the recipe and we loved it. Will be making regularly.
Substituted mushroom soup for chicken noodle because thats all I had!
Great basic recipe. Needed spices - one time I added Mexican seasoning, another Italian. Could substitute chicken.

My husband and mother in law REALLY loved this; both had three helpings! I actually poured all into a baking dish and topped with butter coated panko for a crispy element then popped it under the broiler for a few minutes until golden brown. My husband said it would be even better to top instead with buttery Ritz crackers (add extra butter by browning broken crackers in pan with butter then putting on casserole then under the broiler.)
Delicious recipe. Added green pepper, 1/4 cup onion, 1 tsp minced garlic. Used 1/4 c. white wine and 1/4 c. water. The rest of the recipe was the same. Loved it. Oh, I didn't use pimento.

I made it as per the recipe but without the permento's. It was ok but i will definitely add seasoning and maybe see if the kids will let me get away with adding some steamed veg. They approve of it and want it again.

Just made this AWESOME dish last night! It was quick and easy. I didn't add the pimentos (didn't have), otherwise made exactly as Susan's recipe called for and my whole family enjoyed it! THANK YOU -- Susan!
Loved it! I used Boars Heat Deli meat and browned it a bit before I started the recipe. Came out great!
Easy, quick and delicious~ I did us 1/2 wine and 1/2 water as other reviewers suggested.

Darn good recipe...though, like many pasta dishes it accepts tweakings. I added Mushrooms and certainly used Pimento's and fresh Parsley as called for which helps a lot. Broccoli is NOT an instead of ingredient...it's just an added one...as I did for some additional green (besides Parsley) and nutrition. I added Cayenne Pepper , giving it a mild heat bite (be careful).
Loved this! I was out of pimento so I used a tiny bit of siracha and some freeze dried peppers. I like to add French fried onions on top before putting it in the oven for extra crunch and flavor.
Excellent. I added more ham and vegetables...
This was really good! Made enough to feed my family of five!
I followed the recipe and added black olives with Mrs. Dash seasoning. Turned out quite well, definitely fast to make.

Made it with leftover Easter ham. I did take the advice of various reviews and changed the recipe a bit. I used milk instead of water, added minced garlic, a whole onion and yellow chopped pepper. I also used more cheddar cheese and parmesan. Just eyeball it in the pot for thickness and add more milk if necessary. It was good!
My husband said, "I love this dinner. With a capital L-O-V-E" So I guess he liked it :-). Only change was to add some peas I had on hand.

I’ve made this a few times now. I did increase the amount of cheese, used milk instead of water as another reviewer suggested and used an additional cup of ham. A nice quick meal! I did find it a little bland the find time I made it but have been experimenting with different spices to give it a little kick. On the rare occasion we have leftover bacon I will dice that up and throw it in as well.
I left out the peppers, since neither of us care for them, and it was a little bland. I’m not sure if I would make it again, but it was nice for a change from the old standbys
I liked it, but If you have picky eaters this is a NO.
My husband loves this recipe, I think it's a little salty.

My first Tetrazzini. It was great, but I had to make lots of substitutions cause we are cleaning out the refrigerator for Snow birding. 1. Canned cream soups are too salty for my 60+ diet. I sautéed the mushrooms and onions adding canned evaporated milk. 2 I used cream cheese that was on hand. Served 3.

This is a great pasta base. I’m was honestly better than expected! I had a ton of leftover ham and needed to do something with it. This was easy (had everything on hand) and pretty quick. I think I would enjoy chicken in this sauce instead of ham.

This was a quick perfect meal for leftover Christmas ham. I made a few changes for allergy friendliness (and I’m super picky). I used cream of chicken and I also used elbow macaroni instead of spaghetti noodles. I noticed there wasn’t any seasoning so I added pepper in the sauce as well as salt and (since we have pasta) garlic salt. I also added shredded cheese once plated and my son LOVED IT!!

I used white wine in place of water and added some milk. Also I did not have pimiento so I used red peppers and sautéed them with the onion. I used dried parsley because I did not have any fresh on hand. I followed JulieCC's advice and added garlic too! Turned out great!!
quick and simple, I added fresh spinach
No changes..just blah..would never try again...

This is almost exactly how I've been making mine for 30 years. The only thing i do differently is add a tbsp of worcestershire sauce and I use golden mushroom soup. My family loves it everytime I make it.
I didn't have pimentos, so I added extra herbs (fresh oregano and basil). I'm not a great cook, so I'm pleased with how it turned out. Easy - tasty - definitely a keeper.

This dish is perfect for what it is. Good, crowd-pleasing comfort food and most importantly quick and easy. I enjoy cooking healthy, exciting recipes with lots of prep work. There are also times when I'm feeling lazy, not in the mood to experiment and just want to make something easy that pretty much everyone will like. Everyone loved it and asked for me to make it again so that makes it five star for me. It is a little bland for most adult tastes imo but it makes a good base to customize to personal tastes. I personally would add a little more cheddar cheese and veggies (broccoli, cherry tomatoes, basil, whatever you have in your freezer) and some fresh parmesan cheese and pepper. This is going in my favorites, thanks!
I recommend seasoning it to your taste, but delicious. I used the noodle water with cream of celery. Next time I'll season it more though.

My family did not care for this recipe. We found it to be a little too rich/heavy/creamy for our taste. It did have good flavor and would be fine for folks that are accustomed to this type of meal (we tend to eat lighter/fresher).
Tried this to use up leftover ham from Easter dinner. Husband raved about it and said he hoped we have leftover ham more often. This will have many reruns at our house.
I left out the peppers and the Presley. Other than that, it was delicious!

This was great just changed things up a bit . I didn't have any fresh parsley or pimento peppers so I added some frozen peas and carrots also used low fat mushroom soup and low fat shredded Cheddar cheese. Definitely a keeper for my recipe box especially since I have always found it difficult to find good recipes to use up leftover ham
OMG this was one of the best pasta dishes I have ever made.

Made this with some left over ham from New Years and it was wonderful. I didn't have mushroom soup so made my own cream sauce with rue, cream and white wine. I also added fresh mushrooms and fire roasted peppers instead of pimento. It was great! thanks for this it goes into rotation .
Added celery and bell peppers and increased the onion to the saute. Otherwise made as directed. It was a hit with a side salad and garlic toast.
Simple, easy and tasty. You could easily add a vegetable (like broccoli) to beef up the portion sizes or add some garlic for more zing.

I used spaghetti squash, and next time would like to use more flavors. My husband and I think gouda cheese perhaps! And, I accidentally got cilantro instead of parsley which was yummy! Maybe I will actually try the parsley next time.

I made this tonight. I made a few changes to my own tastes, but not many. I added some garlic and pepper, used chicken broth instead of water, I used Monterey Jack and Cheddar cheese and doubled the amount, then added peas and about double the ham. I also ended up needing almost double the chicken broth (or water) than the recipe called for. It really is a good recipe and I'll make it again.
I thought this recipe was too bland.

I kicked up a bit because I was afraid it would be too bland. I substituted blue cheese for the cheddar, added some fresh garlic, a touch of ground cloves and cayenne pepper, and a pinch of korinje cinnamon. Added a half of a vidalia onion and a half of green bell pepper, minced. I omitted the pimento. Subbed milk for water and threw in a splash of German brandy. Used farfalle pasta instead of spaghetti for a different mouth feel. I love to play with basic recipes like this! Great way to use up the ham I had in the freezer.
Left out the pimento peppers, because, well, we don't like them. This was FANTASTIC anyway. will definitely make this again.
Will definitely keep the recipe. It was a bit bland. We added extra ham, and some garlic salt.

This is a great cheap meal.My husband loved it. The only thing I changed was I used milk instead of water for a little more nutrition. Next time I will add a couple of tablespoons of green peppers for more flavour.
I've made it several times. I have used leeks instead of onions, and I always add frozen peas.

It was delish!!! After reading some of the reviews, I did make a few changes. I used milk instead of water. Added a few cloves of garlic to the onion and butter. And used shredded romaneo cheese along with the shredded cheddar. One can of cream of mush and one can of cream of chick. (I doubled the recipe). Yum yum!! 
Great way to use that leftover ham :)

The whole family loved this dish. It's a great way to use up leftover ham. I did not have pimento and thought it needed something green so I added a cup of frozen peas at the end and some quartered cherry tomatoes, about eight. I will make this again.
This was really a good sauce. We put it over spaghetti squash. Very good way to use up ham.

This recipe was decent but rather bland. Most of the flavor came from the ham, which is not ideal for a pasta recipe. I subbed milk for the water and threw in seasoned salt, celery salt, fresh ground pepper, paprika, and 4 minced garlic cloves to add some flavor. I also added parmesan. Served over whole grain spaghetti noodles.
Love this recipe. Make it occasionally. No changes, turns out great every time
We made a double batch of this one! We only had one can of cream of mushroom

Followed another reviewer's comments to use cream of chicken soup instead of mushroom, sauteed 1 small onion, 2 garlic cloves and 1/2 of small bell pepper in butter. I also used 2 cups ham instead of one. Still needed a little more seasoning so will play with it a little more next time.

This was such an excellent meal that filled my family up. I only adjusted and added a few things that others had tried. I added broccoli, a little garlic, mixed shredded cheese (mild cheddar and sharp) used Cream of Celery instead since that is what I had in my pantry and added a little milk ( 1/4 water, 1/4 milk) and mixed in the can of Cream of Celery and then added it. I served with homemade biscuits and a toss salad. This is a keeper for sure since I don't even have left overs. :-)

yum, quick, and easy. great way to use ham leftovers. 

I used Cream of Chicken soup, white wine, garlic, celery, red pepper, cheddar cheese, and a dollop of Dijon mustard. added 1/2 cup plain yogurt.
I too had to improvise to what I had at hand. I had cream of chicken and egg noodles. boy it was awesome. this is a good basic meal. we enjoyed it full heartedly. I will make again.
I didn't have to make any changes and it tasted great, we ate the whole thing (about 4-5 servings) just the two of us.

Changed this up a bit because of the ingredients I had on hand. I used a half onion, doubled the ham, added mushrooms and used red pepper instead of pimiento. I added 1 cup of old cheddar and some fresh pepper. It was quick and easy. I served on Linguini instead of spaghetti.
